12: Read and Write limitations with folding have been clarified. These
13: limits allow the possibility of warriors essentially running in a
14: mini-core inside core, folding out-of-bounds access attempts back into
15: accessible memory. The main advantages to folding are: old-style
16: bombers like Dwarf do not unfairly and unknowingly spend cycles doing
17: nothing, and movement to seek and destroy enemy warriors is still
18: encouraged by the limits. The main disadvantage is that limits which
19: are not factors of the size of core lead to unexpected results.
20: Example: a reference to address location -1 is adjusted to M-1 when

18: moot questions about whether ADD, SUB, etc. should use one or two

12: 0312 A load file represents the minimum amount of information necessary for
13: 0313 a warrior to execute properly and is presented in a very simple format
14: 0314 which is a subset of the assembly file format presented in Section 2.
15: 0315 A standard load file format allows programmers to choose assemblers
16: 0316 and MARS programs separately and to verify assembler performance and
17: 0317 MARS performance separately.  Not all Core War systems will necessarily
18: 0318 write load files (for example, those which assemble directly to core),
19: 0319 but all systems should support reading load files.
